alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 4:21AM AKDT until March 19 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM AKDT SUNDAY FROM DILLINGHAM NORTH... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches. North winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibilities reduced to one half mile. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, from Dillingham north. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty north winds develop Saturday evening before a brief band of heavy snow arrives early Sunday morning. Snow and winds taper off through the morning hours, leading to improved conditions by midday Sunday. The area of greatest threat is for the villages of Koliganek and New Stuyahok. Dillingham may also see a period of low visibility from blowing snow, but this is lower confidence. Weaker winds and uncertainty with the westward extent of heavy snow may limit impacts there.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
